40108MBTAA-d-01-08-94-ATK.Narrative: SNOW EXTRA IDENTIFIED BY TRAIN #PX 1059 WAS APPROACHING NORTH STATION ON TRACK 6. THE CONSIST WAS MBTA LOCO 1059 LEADING SIX COACHES AND MBTA LOCO 1059 TRAILING IN A MANUAL MODE. THE ENGINEER MADE A BRAKE APPLICATION AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PLATFORM. THEN ANOTHER BRAKE APPLICATION APPROXIMATELY TWOCAR LENGTHS INTO THE PLATFORM. ABOUT THREE CAR LENGTHS THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. AT THAT POINT,THE ENTIRE CONSIST SLID AND CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE BUNTER. SPEED AT THE TIME OF THE EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION WAS APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH. IMPACT OCCURRED AT APPROXIMATELY 2 TO 3 MPH. THE INCIDENT COMMITTEE DETERMINED THE CAUSE TO BE EXCESSIVE ICE BUILD UP BETWEEN BRAKE SHOES AND WHEELS ON ALL CARSIN THE CONSIST. A REASONABLE CAUSE DRUG TEST USING AMTRAK AUTHORITY WAS PERFORMED ON BOTH ENGINEERAND CONDUCTOR WHO WERE LOCATED AT THE LEADING END OF THE MOVEMENTS. RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
